message.content:
Asclepias cordifolia is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Asclepias genus. 
It has a woody stem that can grow up to 1m in height. 
The leaves are thick and leathery with a heart-shaped base and can be up to 7cm long. 
The flowers are bright pink with five petals and grow in umbels on the terminal of the stem. 
Asclepias cordifolia is native to western North America and is found in dry, rocky habitats like cliffs and canyons. 
The plant is a host to monarch butterfly larvae. 
It is cultivated in gardens and used in floral arrangements due to its ornamental nature.
